one_liner: Blockchain Federation aims to bring blockchain into every sphere of life, starting with real estate to address slow, bureaucratic processes and lack of transparency.
strengths: Addresses a clear problem: slow, bureaucratic, and opaque traditional real estate transactions (page 4).
Leverages blockchain and NFTs for secure, efficient, and transparent property ownership and transfer (page 5).
Team possesses a strong understanding of blockchain technology, marketing, and sales (page 3).
Offers competitive advantages including increased transparency, effective transaction processes, and reduced costs (page 9).
Targets a large potential market with a Total Available Market (TAM) of 180 Billion (page 12).
Clear business model with multiple revenue streams: NFT minting fees, hardware wallet, and blockchain maintaining fees (page 13).
risks: Significant legal and regulatory compliance challenges in the real estate and blockchain sectors (page 14).
Competition from established direct and indirect players in the real estate market (page 11).
Market adoption risk for blockchain-based real estate transactions among individuals and companies.
Reliance on future fundraising (pre-seed, seed fundraise) to execute the ambitious roadmap (page 10).
Unspecified details regarding the 'Hardware Wallet' offering and its market viability (page 13).
The requested convertible note of 5 lacs (likely INR 500,000) may be insufficient for the extensive roadmap and expenses (page 15).

kevin: What is the specific valuation cap and discount rate for this 5 lac convertible note? (page 15)
What are your projected NFT minting fees and blockchain maintaining fees per transaction? (page 13)
Can you break down the unit economics of a single property transaction on your platform?
What is your customer acquisition cost for both individuals and real estate companies? (page 7)
What are your projected margins on the hardware wallet sales? (page 13)
How much capital do you anticipate needing beyond this 5 lac convertible note to reach profitability? (page 15)
What is the current burn rate for the team and development efforts? (page 2, 10)
How do you plan to manage the high legal and regulatory compliance costs effectively? (page 14)
What is the average transaction value you expect to see on your platform, given properties are listed in ETH? (page 6)
What percentage of the 5 lac ask is allocated to each expense category shown in the pie chart? (page 15)
mark: What specific blockchain technology are you building on, and what are its scalability limitations?
How do you ensure the immutability and security of property ownership records using NFTs? (page 5)
What is your long-term product roadmap beyond the initial marketplace launch? (page 10)
How will you protect against potential smart contract vulnerabilities or hacks?
What is your strategy for data privacy and ownership on the blockchain?
How will you differentiate your technology from other blockchain real estate solutions that may emerge?
What is the defensibility of your 'Hardware Wallet' offering in a competitive market? (page 13)
What is your plan for integrating with existing real estate databases or government registries?
How will you handle potential forks or upgrades to the underlying blockchain?
What is your intellectual property strategy for the platform and its components?
lori: What is the user experience like for an individual buying or selling property using your platform? (page 6)
How will you educate the average consumer about using blockchain and NFTs for real estate?
What is your marketing and branding strategy to appeal to a broad audience? (page 14)
How will you build trust with consumers who are accustomed to traditional real estate processes?
What unique features does your website (Milio) offer to attract and retain users? (page 6)
Have you considered partnerships with existing real estate agencies or brokers to reach consumers?
What is the emotional appeal of buying a home through a blockchain platform?
How will you ensure the platform is accessible and easy to use for non-tech-savvy individuals?
What is your plan for customer support and dispute resolution on a blockchain-based system?
How will you leverage social media and community building to drive adoption? (page 10)
barbara: What is the personal story behind why you chose to tackle the real estate problem with blockchain? (page 4)
How will you build a strong brand identity for Blockchain Federation and Milio? (page 1, 6)
What is your most scrappy or resourceful moment in building this business so far?
How do you plan to engage the community and build a loyal user base? (page 10)
What sales tactics will you use to convince real estate companies to adopt your platform? (page 7)
Tell me about a time your team overcame a significant challenge together. (page 2, 3)
What is your vision for the company's culture as you scale?
How will you use your communication skills to win over skeptical customers? (page 3)
What is the biggest lesson you've learned since starting this venture?
How will you leverage your team's strengths (e.g., risk-taker, calm in stress) to navigate market challenges? (page 2)
robert: How do you plan to compete with established direct competitors like Prologis and Westfields Real Estate? (page 11)
What is your strategy for onboarding large real estate companies onto your platform? (page 7, 10)
How will your pricing structure (NFT minting fees, blockchain maintaining fees) compare to traditional transaction costs? (page 13, 9)
What cybersecurity measures are in place to protect sensitive property and financial data on your platform?
What is your B2B sales pipeline and strategy for engaging real estate companies?
How will you address the regulatory hurdles for international real estate transactions?
What partnerships are you pursuing to accelerate market penetration, especially with Oracle? (page 10)
How will you ensure the legal enforceability of NFT-based property ownership in different jurisdictions?
What is your plan for managing the 'Blockchain Infrastructure Costs' as you scale? (page 14)
How will you differentiate from indirect competitors like Magic Brick and Housing.com, which already have large user bases? (page 11)
